title: New England News Digest
text:

NEW HAMPSHIRE 
Officials ask for help finding hiker 
CONCORD (AP) - New Hampshire Fish and Game officials are seeking the public's help in finding a missing hiker from Mas­sachusetts. 
Officials say 64-year-old Claire Marie Cocuzzo of Westwood, Mass., planned to hike the in White Moun­tains from Oct. 5-10. A fam­ily member reported her missing when she did not return as scheduled. 
Cocuzzo had planned to hike from the Mount Garfield trailhead to Bond Cliff and back - a distances of about 26 miles. 
Officials are asking any­one who had any interac­tion with her to call Fish and Game headquarters at 271-3361. 
MASSACHUSETTS 
Baker unveils bill on opioid abuse 
BOSTON (AP) - Gov. Charlie Baker criticized what he considers a blase attitude among some health professionals about addic­tive painkillers as he intro­duced legislation Thursday as part of his strategy to curtail a deadly surge in drug overdoses in Massa­chusetts. 
Baker called for a 72- hour limit on first-time prescriptions for opioid painkillers and a change in the state's civil commit­ment law. 
The legislation would restrict patients to a three-day supply of painkillers the first time they are prescribed an opioid drug, or when they receive a prescription from a new doctor. Patients could seek refills after the three-day period and exceptions would be made for certain chronic conditions and hospice care. 
The governor has been highly critical of overpre­scribing painkillers, which can lead to addiction to opioids, including heroin. 
MAINE 
Concealed carry law takes effect 
PORTLAND, Maine (AP) - Legal gun owners in Maine no longer need a permit to carry a concealed handgun. 
The new rules took effect Thursday. The law ends a mandatory permit system that had been in effect for more than 90 years. 
The law applies to people 21 or older or military mem­bers age 18 or older. No one can bring a gun to places including courthouses, state parks, schools, federal buildings and on private property when prohibited by the property owner. Top Jobs
